About the Course

Medical Coding (CPC) Training

Medical Training Course covers all aspects of Medical Coding and Medical Terminology including Anatomy, diseases, procedures, diagnostics tools tests, treatments. Master important aspects such as ICD-10-CM (International Classification of Diseases 10th Revision Clinical Modification), CPT (Current Procedural Terminology), and HCPCS (Healthcare Common Procedural Coding System)

  • Training: 90 Hours of Two-way Live Online Interactive Sessions

Course Curriculum

Module 1: The World of Health Care

Preview

  • Daily activities in US medical facilities
  • Responsibilities of Medical coders and Billers, 
  • Career opportunities available to medical coding and billing specialists
Module 2: Medical Terminology

Preview

This module will help the candidate to learn the Introduction to Medical Terminology

Medical Terminology: Dividing and Combining Terms

  • Introduction to Medical Terminology
  • Medical Terminology: Dividing and Combining Terms
  • Abbreviations, Symbols, and Special Terms 
  • Documentation of Medical Records

 

Module 3: Human Anatomy and Physiology

Preview

This module helps the learner to understand the Introduction to the Human Body, Integumentary System, Skeletal System and Articulations

  • Muscular System
  • Nervous System
  • Endocrine System
  • Cardiovascular System
  • Anatomy and Physiology and the ICD-10-CM Code Set
  • Blood and Blood-Forming Organs
  • Lymphatic System
  • Respiratory System
  • Digestive System
  • Urinary System
  • Reproductive Systems
Module 4 Medical Ethics

Preview

This module will help the candidate with the knowledge of Ethics, Compliance, Frauds and Application of Concepts to Medical Coding Specialists

  • Confidentiality with Medical Records
  • Insurance Audits
  • Legal Concepts Involved

 

Module 5: Diagnostic Coding

Preview

This module helps the learner to understand the

  • Introduction to Diagnostic Coding
  • ICD-10 CM Coding Manual Introduction

 

Module 6: ICD-10 CM Diagnosis Coding

Preview

This module helps the learner to understand the Guidelines and Rules

  • Diagnosis Coding Procedures
  • Basic Coding Exercises
Module 7: ICD-10-CM Coding from Infections to Blood Diseases

Preview

This module will equip the candidate with the knowledge of Code infections, parasitic diseases, and neoplasms

  • Coding of endocrine, nutritional, metabolic, and blood diseases

 

Module 8: ICD-10-CM Coding from Mental Disorders to the Respiratory System

Preview

This module will equip the candidate with the knowledge of Diagnosis Coding about the

  • nervous,
  • circulatory, and
  • respiratory system
Module 9: ICD-10-CM Coding from the Digestive System to Pregnancy

Preview

This module helps the learner to understand Digestive,genitourinary systems and Coding diagnoses related to childbirth

  • Puerperium
  • Complications of pregnancy

 

Module 10: ICD-10-CM Coding from the Skin to Conditions of the Perinatal Period

Preview

This module helps the learner to understand the Diagnosis coding of skin and subcutaneous tissue

 

  • Musculoskeletal system,
  • congenital abnormalities
  • How to code related diagnoses
Module 11: ICD-10-CM Coding from Symptoms to Complications

Preview

This module will help the candidate to Learn the skills of Coding symptoms, signs, and ill-defined conditions

  • Coding for injuries
  • Poisoning

 

Module 12: Z Codes, S Codes, and ICD-10-CM Coding Practicum

Preview

This module helps the learner to understand new coding skills ande diagnosis coding knowledge in real-world scenarios

  • Apply V-codes and
  • E-codes in coding situations.

 

 

Module 13: CPT Coding

Preview

This module will help the candidate to Learn the History of procedural coding

  • Differentiate between CPT and HCPCS codes
  • Format of the CPT coding manual &
  • Basic steps of CPT coding.

 

Module 14: CPT Coding from the integumentary system

Preview

This module helps the learner to understand codes related to the integumentary system Coding Biopsies,skin lesions,excisions, burns, breast procedures and skin grafts.

 

Module 15: CPT Coding from the Reproductive Systems to the Operating Microscope

Preview

This module will help the candidate to Learn the skills of Coding from the Reproductive Systems to the Operating Microscope like Code maternity and childbirth procedures

  •  Procedures related to the endocrine, nervous,
  •  Visual, and auditory systems
  • Coding for microscopic procedures
Module 16: CPT Coding for Radiology, Pathology, Medicine, and Anesthesia

Preview

This module will help the candidate to Learn the skills of Coding for Radiology, Pathology, Medicine, and Anesthesia like Radiology terms, subsections, guidelines 

  • Coding radiology procedures

 

  • Guidelines and coding information for pathology and anesthesia

 

Module 17: CPT Coding Evaluation and Management Services

Preview

 

This module helps the learner to understand Coding Evaluation and Management Codes

  • Documentation guidelines and evaluation
  • Management level sections and modifiers.

 

Module 18: Comprehensive CPT Evaluation and Management

Preview

 

This module will help the candidate to Learn the skills of Evaluation and management coding,

  • Coding auditing process &
  • Encounter forms usage in Coding specialist's work.

 

Module 19: Comprehensive Surgery Coding

Preview

This module will help to understand the concept of Practice procedure coding 

  • CPT codes specific to surgery.

 

Module 20: Musculoskeletal Coding.

Preview

This module helps the learner to understand the Comprehensive Musculoskeletal Coding.

 

Module 21: Digestive System Coding.

Preview

This module will help to understand the concept of Comprehensive Digestive System Coding.

 

Module 22: Urology and Reproductive system coding.

Preview

This module will contribute to understanding of your concept on Comprehensive Urology and Reproductive system coding.

 

Module 23: Pulmonology and Cardiovascular coding.

Preview

This module will help to understand the concept of Comprehensive Pulmonology and Cardiovascular coding.

 

Module 24: CPT Coding for Radiology, Pathology

Preview

This module will help the candidate to Learn the skills of Comprehensive Digestive System Coding.

 

Module 25: Anesthesia Coding

Preview

This module will help to understand the concept of Comprehensive Anesthesia coding.

 

Module 26: HCPCS Coding

Preview

This module will help the candidate to Learn the skills of use coding resources available to them throughout their medical coding careers

  • Associations, websites, continuing education, and certification options
  • Importance of Coding Charges and Research

Training Certification Process

1

Counselling and Registration

Consult with our counselors to check your eligibility in the right batch, and then Register for the Medical Coding Training Course

2

Complete the Medical Coding Course

Attend 90 hours sessions and gain 90 credits to get course completion certification from Henry Harvin Medical Academy

3

Deliver Projects Assigned

Gather experience with real-world assignments and practical projects to upgrade your existing skills. Deliver these mini-projects to be eligible for Henry Harvin Medical Coding Course

4

Earn Certification

Post-successful completion of the course, earn Henry Harvin Medical Coding Training Certification. Post it on social media, get it framed, and increase your value in the industry


What will you get?

you get one

Introduction to Medical Coding

Medical coding translates healthcare services into standardized codes for billing and records.

you get two

Introduction to Revenue Cycle Management

Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) handles the financial process from patient services to payment.

you get three

Medical Terminology, Anatomy, Physiology, Pathology, Laboratory Techniques, etc.

Medical terminology covers terms related to these techniques.

you get four

ICD-10-CM Coding Conventions and Chapter specific guidelines

ICD-10-CM coding conventions guide accurate classification of diagnoses and treatments.

you get five

Introduction to CPT Procedure Coding Terminologies

CPT coding terms standardize codes for medical, surgical, and diagnostic services.

you get six

HCPCS basic Guidelines and Modifiers

HCPCS guidelines and modifiers rule coding for non-physician services and supplies.

you get seven

Introduction on HIPAA rules and guidelines

HIPAA rules and guidelines protect patient privacy and secure healthcare information.

you get eight

Patient report analysis with sample medical records

Patient report analysis reviews medical records to assess health information and coding accuracy.

you get nine

Final certification exam and Mock Interview

Assessment and practice interview to prepare for coding roles.

you get ten

CPC Certification Training

Our Certification Training program will teach you from the fundamentals of medical coding, prepare you for certification, and help you establish yourself in the industry by getting the certification.

you get eleven

Specialty Training

Our Specialty Training courses will provide the deep learning in specialty-oriented training that will helps to mastered in the specialty like EM, Surgery, Radiology etc.,
